I learned about Ant by examining how Ant's own build file works.  Great
examples in there.
Just start out slow, one target at a time, using the manual to understand
what each task
does.  Ant also has some very knowledgeable people on it's dev and user
lists.
--
Erik Meade             emeade@...
Senior Consultant      Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org


  -----Original Message-----
  From: Peter Spitz [mailto:pspitz@...]
  Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 2001 2:06 PM
  To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
  Subject: RE: [junit] OT: getting started with Ant


  Try http://jakarta.apache.org/ant/index.html.
    -----Original Message-----
    From: Dinwiddie, George [mailto:George.Dinwiddie@...]
    Sent: Wednesday, April 04, 2001 4:57 PM
    To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
    Subject: [junit] OT: getting started with Ant


    Can anyone give me pointers on getting started with Ant?  I'm having a
hard
    time finding
    a good beginning point and the software's name is particularly bad for
    search engines.
